p: trans-Caryophyllene, a sesquiterpene from O. gratissimum, was shown to have dose-dependent analgesic effects in several experimental models of acute and chronic pain such as the formalin test, chronic constriction injury, and the hot-plate test. The authors evaluated the potential mechanisms responsible for the substance's properties and found that the analgesic effect was reversed by several types of antagonists [ 203], thus indicating the involvement of both the opioid and endocannabinoid system [ 204].
